title: With Upload Mapping in place, api calls trigger an unhandled rejection if file is missing.
Library should reject with Error objects
body:
Rejects, callbacks, exceptions are coming back with plain object that looks like: {error: {http_code:404, message: "some message"}}.
It should be an instance of Error class.

title: Uploading using buffer or buffer.toString()
body:
first try:

```js
cloudinary.uploader.upload(req.files.avatar.data, function(result) { 
  console.log(result);
});
```
results in error message:
```
TypeError: file.match is not a function
at C:\<redacted>\node_modules\cloudinary\lib\uploader.js:67:34
```

second approach, converting the buffer to a string:
```js
cloudinary.uploader.upload(req.files.avatar.data.toString('utf8'), function(result) { 
  console.log(result);
});
```
results in error:
```
Error: Path must be a string without null bytes
       at nullCheck (fs.js:135:14)
       at Object.fs.open (fs.js:626:8)
       at ReadStream.open (fs.js:1936:6)
       at new ReadStream (fs.js:1923:10)
       at Object.fs.createReadStream (fs.js:1870:10)
       at post (C:\<redacted>\node_modules\cloudinary\lib\uploader.js:592:10)
```
IIRC, it looks like in the first instance its just not equipped to read a buffer (which it doesn't specify in docs). In second, it appears that it interpreted the stringified buffer as a file name and was a attempting to open the file and read it. This is the case I care about as the documentation on your website states that it is possible to upload file data directly. I would really prefer this approach as to storing the file to disk which creates alot of unnecessary io. So can you rectify this situation for me? What is the solution, as the documentation is certainly lacking, it doesn't even list the api for the library anywhere. the only documentation on your website is for ruby.

title: Uploading video
body:
I am working on uploading video. Here is my codes.

First try:
```
cloudinary.uploader.upload_large(videoFile,
            function(result) {console.log(result); },
            { resource_type: "video" });
```
Second try:
```
cloudinary.uploader.upload_large(videoFile,
            function(result) {console.log(result); },
            { resource_type: "auto" });
```
Thir try:
```
cloudinary.uploader.upload_large(videoFile,
            function(result) {console.log(result); },
            { resource_type: "raw" });
```

All of the code, I am getting TypeError: callback is not a function error. Is there any problem in v1_result_adapter function.

Here is the full stack trace.

```

          return callback(void 0, result);
                 ^

TypeError: callback is not a function

title: No transformations when using utils.download_archive_url
body:
When I attempt to generate a download url, the transformations array doesn't end up becoming part of that url. For example, if I do this:

```js
cloudinary.utils.download_archive_url({
  target_format: 'zip',
  target_public_id: 'hmc_1478615185359',
  tags: 'sometag',
  transformations: ['w960-transparent']
});
```

… and then I log the `cloudinary_params` string from https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/blob/master/lib/utils.js#L966 , I get the following object *without `transformations`*:

```js
{
  timestamp: 1478615185,
  mode: 'download',
  target_format: 'zip',
  target_public_id: 'hmc_1478615185359',
  tags: [ 'sometag' ],
  signature: '…',
  api_key: '…'
}
```

Am I missing something?

title: Status Pending ,While calling async resource() function
Optimize lodash size
body:
HI,

Right now cloudinary is the second biggest dependency in our project, just behind react. And it is because of lodash, who takes > 400k. 
In our project we use the babel lodash plugin to only retrieve lodash modules we use.

Have you considered updating to lodash 4 and only requiring lodash modules you need ?

Thanks !

title: Version 1.4 breaks uploads with transformations
body: In the latest version of the repository 1.4, lib/utils.js line 341, there is a check for width.startsWith("auto"). In prior versions <=1.3, the check is width == "auto". The modification to use startsWith expects that the parameter being passed in is a string. If it is a number, (as it was for me), the function throws an unhandled exception.

title: File uploads with success message but when requested returns 404
body:
The following seems to work.

```
var request = require('request'),
    cloudinary = require('cloudinary'),
    url = "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a3/amanita_bisporigera_17932.jpg", writeStream;

cloudinary.config
    cloud_name : <cloudinary_name>
    api_key : <cloudinary_key>
    api_secret : <cloudinary_secret>
    private_cdn : false

writeStream = cloudinary.uploader.upload_stream(
    function(result) {
        console.log(result);
    }, {
        width: 1000,
        height: 1000,
        resource_type: "auto",
        crop: "limit"
    }
);

request(url).pipe(writeStream)
```

resulting in:

```
{
    public_id: 'ta0odoat1fzgymwoxxb8',
    version: 1466022965,
    signature: 'b716ed245a3f4d363b5309d6664a0584f8f9b028',

}

title: cloudinary.url appends options.format to returned url
body:
`cloudinary.url(image.public_id + '.' + image.format, {format: 'jpg'})` returns a url with the `options.format` extension appended to the default extension. Isn't this incorrect? Shouldn't the format option override? Since you always have to provide an extension if you dont provide the format option.

**Example:** `cloudinary.url('/root/folder/myfile.pdf', {format: 'jpg'})`
**Expected:** `http://.../root/folder/myfile.jpg` (good url)
**Actual:** `http://.../root/folder/myfile.pdf.jpg` (bad url)

I understand that you can just send `cloudinary.url('/root/folder/myfile.jpg')`. But then what's the point of format? This seems broken to me, and makes it difficult to program.

title: Error while trying to list all the videos within a folder?
body:
When I try to list all the videos within a folder using this code

```
cloudinary.api.resources(function(result){console.log(result)}, { resource_type: 'video', prefix: 'my_videos/' });
```

I got this error 

```
/home/fw66/WebstormProjects/cloudinary_npm/samples/photo_album/node_modules/cloudinary/lib/utils.js:1023
          return callback(void 0, result);
                 ^
TypeError: object is not a function
    at /home/fw66/WebstormProjects/cloudinary_npm/samples/photo_album/node_modules/cloudinary/lib/utils.js:1023:18
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/home/fw66/WebstormProjects/cloudinary_npm/samples/photo_album/node_modules/cloudinary/lib/api.js:103:51)
    at IncomingMessage.emit (events.js:117:20)
    at _stream_readable.js:944:16
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:458:13)

Process finished with exit code 8
```

But when I do something like mentioned below, I'm getting all the images instead of videos
`cloudinary.api.resources().then(function(result){console.log(result)}, { resource_type: 'video', prefix: 'my_videos/' });`

Since I'm a newbie to node.js and cloudinary api services, I could not figure out what went wrong. So, please help me out here. Thanks in advance.

**EDIT:** This is a cloudinary SDK version syntax difference issue which is answered at [stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36718734/how-to-list-all-the-images-videos-within-a-folder-from-cloudinary-in-node-js)

title: Trying to call `upload` fails silently if you have not called `config`
Docs don't match invocation params of Uploader function.
body:
Just a quick heads up.

While your [node docs](http://cloudinary.com/documentation/node_integration) state to call `uploader.upload()` with `file, callback, options` in order to set a **Public ID**, it is clear by looking at the function definition [here](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/blob/master/lib/uploader.js#L60) that it should be `filename, options, callback`. Swapping the params results in a `TypeError`.

title: Support subfolder overlay url
body:
# WARNING

This PR will make some tests fail. It is not because of new functionality braking older stuff, it is because a helper method was making all tests using it pass. See #89.

Should this PR be accepted, someone must fix the tests which are now failing.

---

This PR adds support for passing `public_id` string containing folders to an overlay transformation.
Example:
`cloudinary.image("mountain.jpg", { overlay: "folder/cloudinary_icon", width: 100 });`

It does that by wrapping strings into objects when passed into the `process_layer()` method in `utils.coffee`.

You could as well wrap the `public_id` before passing it into the transformation:
`cloudinary.url("mountain.jpg", { overlay: { public_id: "folder/cloudinary_icon" }, width: 100 });`

But this is not currently documented. I say either remove support for passing `public_id` strings entirely and fix the docs, or support folders as well.

This PR fixes #88.

title: [Suggestion] Allow passing absolute urls to .image() and .url()
body:
We are storing absolute cloudinary urls in our database. The clients can then decide how they want to transform the urls. Now we are running into (minor) problems using these absolute urls with this sdk.

We just removed the parts of the urls before passing them into these methods.
Examples of urls we are working with:

```
http://res.cloudinary.com/oz/image/upload/moments/c1f9064b-088f-4a42-9c8a-1f67eb441aa8/e88d82b4-d2ae-4d63-8988-25a275b4b960/70ac2da0-34df-4b57-be61-3c88fa1655b0_540_pv.jpg
----------------------------------------- ^ public_id begins
```

```
https://res.cloudinary.com/oz/moments/c1f9064b-088f-4a42-9c8a-1f67eb441aa8/e88d82b4-d2ae-4d63-8988-25a275b4b960/70ac2da0-34df-4b57-be61-3c88fa1655b0_540_pv.jpg
----------------------------- ^ public_id begins (auto upload rule applies)
```

```
http://res.cloudinary.com/oz/image/upload/v1454951830/moments/musicreach/f3432155-1be9-4510-9c3a-c1672c21fc89/f5de39a0-7ad0-48de-b53b-1d148856bcb8_540_pv.jpg
----------------------------------------------------- ^ public_id begins
```

So we created this simple method to extract the `public_id` from the absolute url:

``` JavaScript
function getPublicId (url) {
  return url.replace('image/upload/', '')
  .replace('://res.cloudinary.com/oz/', '')
  .replace(/https?/, '')
  // Removes version part
  .replace(/v[^\/]*\//, '');
}
```

Of course this method is specific to our needs.
The thing is we are not sure whether this handles all possible cases. It would be really helpful if one could just pass the absolute url to the sdk and it would take care of extracting the `public_id`.
Another possible solution would be to expose a method for extracting the `public_id` from any cloudinary url.

title: Some overlay/underlay tests result in false positives
body:
While looking into #88 I found there are some tests that pass but shouldn’t because of this line:
https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/commit/4c82bd5c4d0347429b7ea018f786f1a061fd6ec8#diff-05cd809ce43e834477d56116c1cc9a7aR18

If `true ||` is removed from this line, 5 tests begin to fail.

title: Passing public_id to overlay does not support folders
optimized speed of generate_transformation_string
body:
Benchmark: https://gist.github.com/bompus/c439ec71844ff1cbea26

My results were.. 
before 2034ms ( [profile screenshot](http://screencast.com/t/vAkBYhKkodE) )
after 256ms ( [profile screenshot](http://screencast.com/t/9WHGps1a0F) )

While it might not seem to do much on a single run, it does when you have a heavy traffic, image heavy site. We were actually seeing this function call jump to the top of our v8 profiling regularly due to the synchronous code it runs. lodash.sortBy may be powerful, but unnecessary in this case.

title: Migrate depreciated _.include to _.includes
body: The lodash _.include method is depreciated and is removed in 4.0.0. This small PR updates the usage to _.includes, which is already being used by uploader.js

title: [Question] How to run test?
body:
I could see that we have `npm run test` which runs compilation and then mocha. Besides, there is also `Cakefile` for `cake test`.

It'd be nice if the team decided on a consistent way to run test.

Hi team,

There is no option to set a remote image url when a cloudinary widget is opened. Could you add the option?

title: Working with es6 modules?
body:
Hey,

I am just trying to import the package in an es6 app,
But I've got an error from the sources of the `chunking-stream` dependency module.

Basically, just the call of :

```
import cloudinary from 'cloudinary';
```

throws an error : `Uncaught Error: Cannot find module './lib/size-chunker'`

My environment :

```
node: v0.12.4
cloudinary: v1.2.5

// For the story, I am building a mobile app in es6 using React.js
browserify: v11.1.0
babelify: v6.3.0
react: v0.14.0
```

title: Generate upload signatures
body: There is no documentation that I can find on generating secure upload signatures for upload clients. The iOS documentation says that the serverside SDKs should support this but I cannot find documentation. Please advise. Thanks!

title: fixes #65 - upload_large using chunk_size is corrupting data
body: fixes #65 - upload_large using chunk_size is corrupting data - also adds the very useful upload_large_stream function. upload_large tests now verify data integrity.

title: upload_large using chunk_size is corrupting data
body:
I'm trying to upload an 8mb file ( type raw or image ) using a chunk_size of 6000000. What I am seeing is that on completion, the file size matches, but the file data is corrupted around the location of the second chunk.

I've tried several different files including dummy test files, jpegs, and pdfs of different sizes. If the file is transmitted using a single chunk ( chunk_size is larger than file size ) , the md5 matches. If multiple chunks are involved, the md5 is different, and the md5 changes as you experiment with different chunk sizes ( 5500000 vs 6000000 for example )

Can you update your tests for upload_large ( and all other upload tests? ) to check filesize AND compare etag/md5 to the original md5 to verify the uploaded data matches.

title: Different colors for the same image
body:
I'm trying to upload one image, and always get different results for colors:

``` bash
> c.uploader.upload('http://res.cloudinary.com/dlvphoomb/image/upload/v1441577895/m8wm8q4fnqqtegdumsog.png', function(result){console.log(result.colors)}, {colors: true})
[object Object]
> [ [ '#FF0000', 60 ], [ '#00FF00CC', 40 ] ]
> c.uploader.upload('http://res.cloudinary.com/dlvphoomb/image/upload/v1441577895/m8wm8q4fnqqtegdumsog.png', function(result){console.log(result.colors)}, {colors: true})
[object Object]
> [ [ '#FF0000', 60 ], [ '#00FF005A', 40 ] ]
> c.uploader.upload('http://res.cloudinary.com/dlvphoomb/image/upload/v1441577895/m8wm8q4fnqqtegdumsog.png', function(result){console.log(result.colors)}, {colors: true})
[object Object]
> [ [ '#FF0000', 60 ], [ '#00FF002C', 40 ] ]
> c.uploader.upload('http://res.cloudinary.com/dlvphoomb/image/upload/v1441577895/m8wm8q4fnqqtegdumsog.png', function(result){console.log(result.colors)}, {colors: true})
[object Object]
> [ [ '#FF0000', 60 ], [ '#00FF0017', 40 ] ]
> c.uploader.upload('http://res.cloudinary.com/dlvphoomb/image/upload/v1441577895/m8wm8q4fnqqtegdumsog.png', function(result){console.log(result.colors)}, {colors: true})
[object Object]
> [ [ '#FF0000', 60 ], [ '#00FF00', 40 ] ]
```

title: cloudinary.url() promise
Cloudinary Upload Request getting Timed Out for images of size greater than 50 Kb
Cloudinary Integration using Node.js
Adding samples and test to .npmignore
body:
Can we please not publish the samples and tests to npm?

These add 25MB+ to the `npm install` payload when cloudinary is used as a dependency for absolutely no reason.

They're fine to be included when someone `git clone`s this repo, that makes sense, but otherwise these are being installed on [17,000+ servers per month](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cloudinary).

`{ error:

     http_code: 401 } }`

i followed the config example provided in the documentation. looks like: 

`cloudinary.config({
  cloud_name: 'some-cloud',
  api_key: API_KEY,
  api_secret: CLOUD_API_SECRET
});`

can anyone tell me what i'm doing wrong?

title: Allow to pass cloudinary url in config method
body:
I think it would be nice to explicitly pass clodinary_url to config method. Im not 100% happy with this commit since signature with single string param is already taken by getter. Added some tests to cover old and new use cases.

What do you think?

title: Modularize client-side utils
body:
Maybe I'm missing something, but here is a suggestion I'm contributing based on my current understanding.
### Use Case

I want to use utils.url to generate urls in the client side part of a web app. I want to be able to include that part of the code **only** in my client bundle.
### Suggestion

From that use case comes my suggestion:
  Make the util url standalone so it can be included by a bundler by itself without all the other stuff.
This would be super useful for all of the utils that are useful client side. Make them all modules that can be included by themselves as needed.

title: Doesn't work with React Native
body:
Due to crypto dependency.

![ios simulator screen shot jul 23 2015 3 54 08 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/988213/8850757/51d6dbcc-3153-11e5-8f32-5c7b9c7d8561.png)

title: cloudinary.image mutates option arguement
Update cloudinary.js to copy over options instead of mutating
body:
Instead of using in the passed in `options` argument in `.image`, we use `_.extend` to make a shallow copy of the `options` object passed in. Therefore, there will be no way of mutating the `options` object directly.

This happens in `.video` too but the `options` are deep cloned later on. I still used `.extend` as I do not know if anything before the deep clone mutates `options`.

Added tests as well :)

Issue: #55 

Side note: We are not deep copying so deeper objects could possibly be mutated. Not worrying about this unless objects to get mutated at a deeper level.

title: Can't get image width and height by PreloadedFile
body:
While I upload from the browser, I can only get the preloaded_file by image_id.  But preloaded_file does not provide image width and height after uploading.

Or how can I get the width height?

title: Params not getting passed in DELETE method
Stream Errors
body:
First, great job on the module!

I have been trying to kill a bug when upgrading from version 1.0.13 to 1.1.0 or anything higher.  I am working up a test and reproduction instructions right now, will post details in a few.  

Here is the initial error when trying to kill the stream:

```
_stream_writable.js:344
  if (!state.ending && !state.finished)
            ^
TypeError: Cannot read property 'ending' of undefined
    at Stream.Writable.end (_stream_writable.js:344:13)
    at Stream.emit (events.js:92:17)
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous>     (/home/mclenithan/www/soundselect/node_modules/webshot/lib/webshot.js:242:9)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:98:17)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:820:12)
```

If this sounds obvious, stop me there, otherwise I will have a write up to follow shortly.

title: Add method to generate a webhook signature.
body:
This is used to validate that the webhook API call is legit.  Closed #39 
Added a single test

title: Add method to generate a webhook signature
Distribute as compiled JavaScript
body: Right now all files in `lib` are distributed as coffeescript and `cloudinary.js` uses `require('coffee-script/register');`. Not only does this pollute the global scope `require.extensions` with unneccesary junk but it adds overhead that shouldn't be necessary.

title: Photos cannot be downloaded with the function of private_download_url
body:
I've been using cloudinary for a long time and everything is fine. And it's also ok to upload private photos and pdfs. 

But today when I tried to download the private photos, something went wrong.

```
var url = cloudinary.utils.private_download_url(publicid);
```

The url I get was something like: 

```
https://api.cloudinary.com/v1_1/myappname/image/download?timestamp=1417560245&public_id=mfzmfjhzmcnh2ksp2qs1&signature=4e857d76e3b773b6cbb3129fffed185d725854c8&api_key=616622821755xxx
```

But when I put it in the browser, I got:

```
{
  "error": {
    "message": "Resource not found - mfzmfjhzmcnh2ksp2qs1"
  }
}
```

What the problem could be?
But the mfzmfjhzmcnh2ksp2qs1 is there of course. I saw it in the backend of cloudinary console media_library.

title: fix #34 Upload stream does not support pipe
body: addresses both pipe support and non binary encoding

title: How to get etag?
body: Can you please provide an example of how we can use this library to perform a `HEAD` request to fetch the `etag` for a given public id of an image?

title: Upload stream does not support pipe
body:
It would be great if upload_stream supported normal stream features such as pipe.

Also the callback for the stream does not follow the convention for callbacks in node
